basics.name: Arastoo Zibaeirad
basics.label: Researcher and Developer
basics.summary: I focus on the intersection of machine learning and cybersecurity, with a particular emphasis on adversarial machine learning, the robustness of machine learning models, and the trustworthiness and interpretability of models in adversarial settings.

work.name: University of North Carolina at Charlotte
work.summary: Researching on Adversarial Machine Learning, used Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs). Assisted in 'IT Infrastructure and Security' and 'Operating Systems'.

work.name: Golrang System
work.summary: Developed an automated system using PingCastle to detect folder sharing, extracted clients from Active Directory, and sent targeted emails to close shared folders. Created a program to address device vulnerabilities by identifying new CVEs, collaborated with the monitoring team using NMAP for device details, and updated the OpenCVE API database to bolster network security.

work.name: Andisheh Negar Pars
work.summary: Developed an application designed to correlate network logs, transmit these logs to a database (Elasticsearch), and facilitate log management planning. Managed an 18-node Elasticsearch setup using docker-compose, including master, data, coordinating, and ingest nodes; addressed indexing issues and customized document mapping.

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Charlotte (UNCC)
Iran University of Science and Technology (IUST)

certificates.name: CompTIA Network+ (Computing Technology Industry Association Network Plus)
Linux LPIC-1 (Linux Professional Institute Certification Level 1)

publications.name: A Survey of Cyber, Cyber-Physical, and Coordinated Attacks and Detection Methods in Smart Grids
publications.summary: This comprehensive paper explores a wide range of attacks on smart grids, from historical incidents to future threats. It delves into various protection methods, including game theory, graph theory, blockchain technologies, and a spectrum of machine learning techniques such as supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised, ensemble learning, and reinforcement learning. The focus is primarily on adversarial attacks and corresponding defensive strategies, emphasizing the dynamic and evolving nature of cybersecurity within the realm of energy systems.

publications.name: Bypassing the Black-box DDoS Detection Systems using Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
publications.summary: This study explores the use of GANs to perform black-box attacks with zero knowledge to evade Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) detection systems.
